intro: Vaccinium talamancense, commonly known as the Talamancense huckleberry, is a species of shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers shaded to partially shaded environments. Its botanical features include alternate, oval-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit.
